greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of arccos(sqrt(1/3)) and of arcsin(sqrt(2/3)) and arctan(sqrt(2)).
comment: Angle (in radians) between an edge and (the normal of) a face of the regular tetrahedron. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 23 2012
Also known as magic angle; root of P_2(cos(theta)), with P_2(x) being second-order Legendre polynomial. - _Stanislav Sykora_, May 25 2012
Also the angle between the body diagonal of a cube and an incident edge, and therefore the polar angle of the cone circumscribed to a cube from one of its vertices.
Also half of the tetrahedral angle (A156546).

In nuclear magnetic resonance, the angle, with respect to the direction of the main magnetic field, under which a solid sample needs to be spun in order to average to zero unwanted dipole-dipole spin interactions (the magic angle spinning, or MAS, technique). (end)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Steven R. Finch, Errata and Addenda to Mathematical Constants, p. 53.
Stanislav Sýkora, Magnetic Resonance on OEIS, Stan's NMR Blog (Dec 31, 2014), Retrieved Nov 12, 2019.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Sep 23 2011
